result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Roy M Hanson

records.addlTxt:
10:01 AM - case called.  Defendant Roy M Hanson in court.  Attorney Anne M. Katte in court for Roy M Hanson.  Attorney Andrew R Polzin in court for State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Polzin - Defendant will waive the preliminary hearing.  Court questions Atty Katte/Defendant.  Responses by Atty Katte/Defendant.  Court finds waiver of the preliminary hearing is free and voluntary.  Court finds probable cause that a felony has been committed and binds the Defendant over for further proceedings.  Information filed with the Court.  In receipt - waive reading - plea of not guilty.  Court accepts not guilt plea.  Bond will continue.
Scheduling conference scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 11:00 am.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: 1:37 PM - case called.  Defendant Roy M Hanson appeared by video, in custody from the Lincoln County Jail.  Attorney Nicholas Smith appeared via video, specially.  Attorney Andrew R Polzin in court for State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Smith - in receipt of complaint - waive reading - waive time limits.  Argument by State as to bond.  Court sets bond.  Court accepts waiver of time limits.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 25, 2022 at 10:00 am.
